column2: Writing user input directly to a web page allows for a cross-site scripting vulnerability.
column4: Cross-site scripting vulnerability due to a [["user-provided value"|"relative:///main.py:14:26:14:32"]].

column2: Leaking information about an exception, such as messages and stack traces, to an external user can expose implementation details that are useful to an attacker for developing a subsequent exploit.
column4: [["Stack trace information"|"relative:///main.py:31:25:31:25"]] flows to this location and may be exposed to an external user.

column1: Flask app is run in debug mode
column2: Running a Flask app in debug mode may allow an attacker to run arbitrary code through the Werkzeug debugger.
column4: A Flask app appears to be run in debug mode. This may allow an attacker to run arbitrary code through the debugger.

column2: Making a network request to a URL that is fully user-controlled allows for request forgery attacks.
column4: The full URL of this request depends on a [["user-provided value"|"relative:///main.py:14:26:14:32"]].
